data.title: Mac OS - Highlighting text in the editor requires two clicks when the integrated terminal is open
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: 10.11.5 (15F34) (El Capitan)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file in the editor
2. Open the integrated terminal
3. Type some commands on the terminal
4. Try to copy some text on the editor by highlighting and typing Mac + c
5. You will have to click on the section twice before the text successfully copies

data.title: "Conflict" message overlays resolution bar
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.2.1 - OS Version: 10.10.5 Description: When a file is conflicted, the notification bar overlays needed information for the user to exit that state and potentially leads to a UX dead end. The reasons for this are two fold: 1) The notification bar will not close until you resolve the conflict; however... 2) In order to resolve the conflict, you have to use the resolution buttons on the right. But since the notification bar overlays relevant information, it is extremely difficult to see which file is which (ie. - which one is previous, which one is current) thus making it difficult to know which side to resolve to. Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open any file in VS Code 2. Create a conflicted state on that file using git (ex. - edit the same line on a file that has recently changed on master, and rebase against master) 3. Observe the scenario similar to the attached screenshot.

data.title: Active tab disappears when starting to drag
data.body: Looks like my z-index trick is causing this. @bgashler1 maybe we can find a better way to have the horizontal border on the title area without using z-index nor fiddling with the margins/paddings?

data.title: VSCode becomes unresponsive when reordering files in Working Files list

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
This is happening in a React project with JS and JSX files
1. Have several files open in the Working Files list
2. Click and drag one of the files to a different location in the list.
3. The editor window becomes unresponsive for a long time (10 seconds or more). When viewing Resource Monitor at this time a Code.exe process is pegged at 25% CPU usage.

This has just started recently, but I can't be sure if it has been happening since the last update to VSCode or something after that caused the change.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4274032/16524702/1edc77f8-3f77-11e6-8b75-b1c1c25a9d22.png)

data.title: Windows: Opening VSCode as admin while already open as non-admin does nothing.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Service Pack 1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Code like normal
2. Using any way to open vscode from windows (start menu link, desktop shortcut, program files, etc) right click and choose 'Run as Admin'.

VSCode just highlights the open vscode taskbar icon and doesn't do anything.

data.title: Problems: results and message are not so nicely aligned
data.body:
See video:

![jul-01-2016 15-29-34](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/16522884/af0f4dea-3fa0-11e6-9feb-dc7051ed762c.gif)

data.title: Store if replace input box is visible
data.body:
1. Open search viewlet, open replace, close vscode
2. Open vscode, search viewlet -> I would expect the replace to be visible, it is not

We always try to store UX state, so I think it would be better if you store this instead of just storing if you have shown the replace box for the first time.

data.title: Replace: replace action does not turn disabled when removing matches
data.body: I would expect the replace action to turn disabled as soon as I remove all matches from the preview.

data.title: Replace: clicking on an individual replace action should keep diff open
data.body: When you click on an individual replace action in the preview, I would expect the diff to stay open and just apply the change. Now, actually the file opens where the replacement is run on.

data.title: How to turn off the "Tabs" feature at the top?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insiders 1.3.0-insider (1 July 2016)
- OS Version: Windows 10

Just a simple help request. I'm not a fan of the tabs feature, and looking for it is tough since "tab" is what to call the thing at the top and the key stroke...Anyway, what is the setting to turn it off?

Thanks!

data.title: Extensions: outline over buttons not clearly visible
data.body:
In light theme when I press tab to navigate to the buttons of an extension, I cannot clearly see that the button has focus.

Related https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/7966

data.title: List widget keyboard accessibility needs to be on par with tree
data.body:
When using the extensions viewlet with the keyboard you notice some differences to how it works with the tree. If you tab into the list, the entire list gets the focus outline, where actually the currently selected item should just highlight.

Also, when the list widget has focus, pressing arrow key down should navigate through the list as it does in the tree.

Whatever magic we did in the tree to make it work nice with keyboard also needs to be applied to the list widget 👍 

Related https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/7966

data.title: Run selected text in active terminal is not running the selected text on Windows
data.body:
Windows 8.1 with insiders latest build #716f764

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file and select text "echo 123"
2. Open command pallette and select action Run selected text in active terminal

Expected: Selected text should be executed in the terminal
Actual: Text is just copied into terminal and focus remains in editor

data.title: Hovering over "module" in tsconfig.json gives incorrect suggestions
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.3.0-insider (Commit 716f76458)
- OS Version: Windows 7 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a tsconfig.json file with "compilerOptions" and the "module" property in it.
2. Mouse-hover over the "module" property
3. See that it suggests, among others, "CommonJS", "Amd", "System", etc. (notice case!)
4. Write any of the mentioned module values in the suggested case
5. Observe that neither of those values are accepted and Visual Studio Code tells that only their lower-case values are valid values

data.title: No syntax highlighting for JS functions
html in php not highlight elements
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0-insider and 1.2.1
- OS Version: W8.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open an php file that has both php and html and the file type is PHP - the html brackets highlight not workingas it should

You should add the option to select html brackets including in php file not only html
The right selection - http://prntscr.com/bnfaaa
The bad selection and that should be combined - http://prntscr.com/bnfaym

Thanks

data.title: About vscode Integration
data.body: Ask a question, I want to integrate my vscode inside an application , how can I do it ?

data.title: C grammar pushes states and does not pop them for sqlite3.c
data.body:
Spin off from #7912

In #7912 I have fixed the crash and reduced the memory usage significantly.

But the C grammar is still broken IMHO.

From my logging, by the end of the file it has more than 50 pushed states that are not popped.

We need to investigate which rule in the C grammar causes this.

[sqlite3.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/343199/sqlite3.zip)

data.title: Sensible settings of windows.zoomLevel result in jittery scrolling

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.1
- OS Version: Mac OS 10.11.2

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use these user settings:

```
{
    "editor.fontSize": 13,
    "editor.lineHeight": 14,
    "window.zoomLevel": -2,
}
```
1. Vertically scroll a text window

Notice that the lines do not stay equidistant from each other, but rather jitter as though each has a non-unit vertical position which is rounded differently.

It's not easy to see from these images, but if you do a pixel-level comparison, you'll see the line beginning "Controls the number of decorations" moves relative to the others.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/138296/16517189/162fd0bc-3f74-11e6-9812-04d6c3ba3d17.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/138296/16517203/285d9742-3f74-11e6-8d99-27477017db77.png)

data.title: Unable to install extensions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.0-insider
- VSCode Commit: 716f76458e4dc93e865b6a999e437ed45774744e
- OS Version: Elementary OS 0.3

Now I am able to search for extensions. Only I am not able to install them. Nor do I get any feedback.

I really wish to give more information. But also the dev tools do not give any feedback. Even with Pause On Caught Exceptions.
